The fighter torso (called the Penance torso in the Barbarian Assault Reward Shop) is armour that requires 40 Defence to equip and is a reward from the Barbarian Assault minigame. It is purchased from Commander Connad for 375 honour points in all four roles and one Penance Queen kill and it can be sold back to him for 300 honour points in all four roles by using it on him.

It will remain in the player's inventory if they die below level 20 Wilderness, but will be unusable until repaired by using 50,000 coins on Perdu or on an armour stand in a PvP world.

Note: It is possible to obtain at any level, but low level players may struggle specifically with the attacker role and may wish to "leech" from a trained 4 player team in exchange for a large sum of Coins. However, it is usually done on Ironman accounts as the money on a standard account may be comparable to buying a Bandos chestplate, but with worse defensive bonuses, and no option to trade the torso to other players.

Contents

  • 1 Advantages
  • 2 Treasure Trails
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 Trivia

Advantages[edit | edit source]

The fighter torso is one of the most popular and frequently used armour pieces for melee training, where maximizing damage output via strength bonus outweighs the benefit of any other equipment bonus. Its strength bonus is tied with the Bandos chestplate and inquisitor's hauberk but only costs time playing Barbarian Assault instead of coins.

It has the highest negative magic accuracy possible in the body slot, making it an effective armour for splashing.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

The fighter torso is the item Falo requires players to show him when he sings about: Penance healers runners and more, obtaining this body often gives much deplore.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
20 August 2015
(update)

The fighter torso now correctly covers the torso.

20 August â€“
2 October 2014

The "Destroy" option was replaced with a "Drop" option.

8 August 2013
(update)

Some feedback changes have been made to the config costs of the fire cape, rune defender and penance items, including the penance skirt.

2 August 2013
(update | poll)

The item's value was increased from 20,000 to 65,006 so it is protected over rune armour upon death.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The fighter torso does not interfere with Ava's devices.
